title: Computer Ethics
description: Covers ethical and societal issues in computing including privacy, security, and intellectual property.

title: Discrete Structures for Computing
description: Introduces logic, set theory, relations, functions, and combinatorics as foundational tools in computer science.

title: Data Structures
description: Focuses on data organization, including arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs.

title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
description: Covers advanced algorithm design strategies including divide-and-conquer, dynamic programming, and greedy algorithms.

title: Fundamentals of Database Systems
description: Introduces relational databases, query languages, normalization, and database design.

title: Computer Architecture and Organization I
description: Explores the structure and functionality of digital computers, including CPU design and memory hierarchy.

title: Software Engineering
description: Covers software development lifecycle, requirements engineering, design patterns, and testing.

title: Data Communication and Computer Networks I
description: Covers principles of data transmission, OSI layers, and protocols used in computer networks.

title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: Introduces security concepts such as threats, vulnerabilities, cryptography, and risk management.

title: Web Development Fundamentals
description: Covers the basics of building responsive websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: Operating Systems
description: Covers OS concepts like processes, memory management, scheduling, and file systems.

title: Computer Ethics
description: Discusses ethical dilemmas in modern computing environments.

title: Data Structures
description: Analyzes performance and implementation of core data structures.

title: Discrete Structures for Computing
description: Foundational math topics used in algorithm design and computer science theory.

title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
description: Efficiency and complexity analysis of algorithms in software development.

title: Computer Architecture and Organization I
description: Focuses on low-level design and microarchitecture of modern processors.

title: Software Engineering
description: Best practices and methodologies for building large software systems.

title: Fundamentals of Database Systems
description: Comprehensive intro to RDBMS, schema design, and query optimization.

title: Operating Systems
description: Explores concurrency, resource management, and system-level software.

title: Data Communication and Computer Networks I
description: Introduction to protocols, switching, and network layers.
